content: can any one help me. i am currently switching from reserves to active duty. once i process through meps again and am assigned my duty station, can i drive my POV to that duty station? thanks
reply: can any one help me. i am currently switching from reserves to active duty. once i process through meps again and am assigned my duty station, can i drive my POV to that duty station? thanks
title: Pov to duty station

content: Yes, but make sure you have enough leave time for the drive. When you get to new post, register the POV at main gate. Have license, proof of insurance, and vehicle registration from your state. Oh ya, ask meps to put on your orders "Travel authorized by POV to Ft. ??????????" Good luck Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!
reply: Yes, but make sure you have enough leave time for the drive. When you get to new post, register the POV at main gate. Have license, proof of insurance, and vehicle registration from your state. Oh ya, ask meps to put on your orders "Travel authorized by POV to Ft. ??????????" Good luck Break glass…in case of Emergency! Or, just wait till I get to the bottom of the bottle!

content: quote: Originally posted by jamesl2323: no i got that school after my tour im prior service. thanks for the help guys james.... it is helpful around here to have something in your bio,, the is helpful when we go look at a persons profile... since you changed from E-1 (since I first read your profile) to E-4 you might want to mention who you were with and where you were assigned. You do have to admit someone saying they're an E-1, no other info/awards and jump wings could be construed as questionable. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE

content: James, thank you for filling in some infor about yourself, and what you have done does matter here - that is why we question sometimes...so, your additional info goes a long way here.. and as you visit this place and get to know some folks and become a regular you too will question new posters on ocassion. An example, a year or so go there was a new poster with two, yep, two MOH's. Impressed many here. Or even most recently we had a kid with ribbons from all five services... so, like I mentioned previously, don't judge us to harshly. One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
